newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Parana state to see higher sugarcane output.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Parana state to see higher sugarcane output.

text.p: The Brazilian state of Parana should produce 25 million tonnes of sugarcane this harvest, up from 23 million tonnes in 1996/97, the State Agricultural Secretariat said in a press release.

Parana output is expected to account for between eight and 10 percent of national production, put by the secretariat at 300 million tonnes in 1997/98. Brazilian sugar production is forecast at 14.8 million tonnes, the secretariat said.
Within the government crop plan, total sugar output is plotted at 13.48 million tonnes, 760,000 tonnes of which are to come from Parana.
The state's sugar and alcohol industries are running into problems due to a shortage of labor, the release said.
The local sugar and alcohol producers' association estimates there are 4,000 workers too few to cut the cane due to the migration of workers to large urban areas, it added.
